Script for generating contact sheets /!/ Since I (sadly) don't have room for or access to a full darkroom, I've lately been just developing negatives and scanning them. This means I also end up without contact sheets, which can make it annoying to find a particular picture/roll I'm looking for.

So I wrote a little script, which takes the name of a directory (I name all of my directories "File XXXX", after the file number on the negative sleeve) and uses ImageMagick's `montage` program (which is available on most Linux distributions, MacOS, and Windows with Cygwin) to generate a contact sheet and save it in a `contacts` directory. It's pretty simple, but it saves me having to memorize the whole command. Anyway, here it is:

    #!/bin/bash
    
    file="$1"
    echo "Generating contact sheet for File $file"
    montage File\ $file/img*.jpg -title "File $file" -geometry 512x512 -border 16x16 -background grey40 contacts/$file.jpg

If you have a different naming scheme you may have to modify it a little bit, hopefully that's straightforward.

I hope this comes in handy for other darkroom-deprived folks!
